source: 211.org, Michigan Veterans Affairs Agency, VOA Michigan, and related Michigan veteran resource directories

resources.name: Michigan Veterans Affairs Agency (MVAA)
resources.address: 3423 N. Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd., Bldg 32, Lansing, MI 48906
resources.description: Central coordinating agency providing support, care, advocacy, and service to veterans and their families. Connects veterans to benefits, education, employment, healthcare, and housing resources. Available 24/7 with 211 agents after hours.

resources.name: Volunteers of America Michigan - Main Office
resources.description: 501(c)(3) nonprofit providing critical services, shelter and food for veterans, affordable housing, and supportive services. Specializes in transitioning veterans from homelessness to stable housing.

resources.name: VOA Michigan - Veterans Transitional Housing (Detroit)
resources.description: Provides transitional housing with comprehensive wrap-around support services to help veterans transition from homelessness to stable housing. Includes case management, employment assistance, art therapy, and special events.

resources.name: VOA Michigan - Burton Location
resources.description: Regional Volunteers of America location providing veteran services including housing, food, and supportive services.

resources.name: Veteran 1st - Michigan Support Services
resources.description: Empowers veterans and their families across Michigan through equitable access to care, community resources, and advocacy. Provides comprehensive support founded by Toni Kennedy, US Army Veteran, serving 8+ Michigan counties.

resources.name: Mid Michigan Community Action - Veteran Homeless Solutions
resources.address: Service area covers Arenac, Bay, Clare, Gladwin, Lake, Mecosta, Midland, Newaygo, Osceola, and Saginaw Counties
resources.description: Provides dedicated housing support for veterans and their families experiencing homelessness or housing instability. Partner organization EightCAP covers Gratiot, Ionia, Isabella, and Montcalm Counties.

resources.name: EightCAP (Partner - Mid Michigan Community Action)
resources.address: Serves Gratiot, Ionia, Isabella, and Montcalm Counties
resources.description: Partner organization providing veteran housing assistance in partnership with Mid Michigan Community Action.

resources.name: Northwest Michigan Community Action Agency (NMCAA) - SSVF Program
resources.address: 3963 Three Mile Rd., Traverse City, MI 49686
resources.description: Provides Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) program across 23-county region in Northwest Michigan. Offers coordinated entry, rapid resolution, street outreach, case management, housing resources, healthcare navigation, and connections to VA and public benefits.

resources.name: VFW Department of Michigan
resources.description: Veterans of Foreign Wars providing Stand Down events (1-3 day events with food, clothing, health screenings), homeless veteran programs, and mental health services.

resources.name: American Legion, Department of Michigan
resources.address: 212 N. Verlinden Ave., Suite A, Lansing, MI 48915
resources.description: Provides expert, no-cost assistance to veterans and their families for VA disability benefits applications, education, and employment resources through certified veteran service officers.

resources.name: American Legion Detroit Veteran Service Office
resources.address: Patrick V. McNamara Federal Building, 477 Michigan Avenue, Room 1231, Detroit, MI 48226
resources.description: Provides local American Legion veteran service officer support for VA disability benefits, education, and employment resources.

resources.name: Michigan Veteran Trust Fund
resources.address: 3423 N. Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd., Bldg 32, Lansing, MI 48906
resources.description: Provides emergency grants to Michigan veterans and dependent family members to help weather short-term financial crisis. Accessible through MVAA.

resources.name: Detroit VA Regional Benefit Office
resources.address: Patrick V. McNamara Federal Building, 477 Michigan Avenue, 12th Floor, Detroit, MI 48226
resources.description: Federal VA office providing veteran benefits processing, disability compensation, and benefits counseling.

resources.name: VA Saginaw Healthcare - Veteran Justice Outreach
resources.description: Provides justice outreach and homeless veteran program resources through Veterans Affairs healthcare system.

resources.name: VA Detroit Healthcare - Homeless Veteran Care
resources.description: Provides specialized homeless veteran care programs and support services.

resources.name: Michigan Works! Veterans Employment Services
resources.description: Provides intensive and individualized employment services to eligible veterans through Michigan Works! American Job Centers. Veterans Career Advisors offer resume development, interviewing skills, housing assistance, transportation support, education and training opportunities.

resources.name: Disability Rights Michigan - Veterans with Disabilities Program
resources.description: Provides resources and advocacy support for veterans with disabilities, helping them navigate services and benefits.

resources.name: Michigan Veteran Navigators Program
resources.description: Assists veterans and military families of all eras and discharge types to connect to federal, state and local resources for mental health, substance abuse, housing and other common issues.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 crisis support line staffed by crisis responders including veterans for immediate mental health and suicide prevention support.

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: 24/7 national hotline for veterans who are homeless or at imminent risk of homelessness to connect with housing and support services.

resources.name: Buddy-to-Buddy Veteran Support Program
resources.description: Matches veterans with veteran counselors trained to help find resources for mental health, substance abuse, financial benefits, education, legal issues, and job support.

resources.name: Legal Services of Eastern Michigan - LSV-H Program
resources.description: Provides free legal services to veterans for homelessness prevention including housing, food stamps restoration, health insurance, and disability benefits.

resources.name: University of Michigan Veterans Legal Clinic
resources.description: Law school clinic providing free legal services to veterans in civil matters including family law, eviction, consumer problems, foreclosure, and employment cases.

resources.name: Michigan 211 Help Line
resources.description: Easy way to connect with help of all kinds through 211 referral specialists. Database of over 27,000 programs for Michiganders. Services available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week in 180+ languages.

resources.name: Operation We Are Here - Michigan Veteran Resources
resources.description: Comprehensive clearinghouse of resources for Michigan military community. Provides free detailed information on grants, emergency assistance, outdoor recreation, and community support programs.

resources.name: Michigan Disabled American Veterans (DAV)
resources.description: Services and support organization providing advocacy and services to Michigan veterans with disabilities.
